Package gameObjects

Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
gameObjects.GameManager
public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a game management system. It enables automatic (efficient) management of the robots. The constructor receives a 0-23 scenario from the server, places the robots optimally, and automatically moves the robots along the graph to collect as much fruit as possible.
Author:
Meir Nizri

  • Constructor Details

    • GameManager

      public GameManager()
      Empty default constructor

    • GameManager

      public GameManager​(int scenario_num)
      Instantiates a new game manager.
      Parameters:
      scenario_num - - the scenario to play from the server.

    • GameManager

      public GameManager​(Server.game_service game)
      Instantiates a new game manager.
      Parameters:
      game - - game server that already has some scenario in it.

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      This function initialize all the variables needed to start the game, such as: the graph, the location of the fruits and the robots, and then start the game.

    • addRobots

      public void addRobots()
      This function is activated before the game starts. It adds the robots to the game in an optimal location for the fruit gathering. It also create ArrayList of all the fruit in the game.

    • fruitChanged

      public boolean fruitChanged()
      Check if one of the fruits has changed.
      Returns:
      true if one of the fruit changed, false otherwise.

    • updateFruits

      public void updateFruits()
      Updating the fruits on the game. This function will be activated after one of the fruits is collected.

    • updateAllRobotsPath

      public void updateAllRobotsPath()
      Update the path of all robots using updateRobotPath function.

    • updateRobotPath

      public void updateRobotPath​(int i)
      This function calculate for robot what is the most profitable fruit to collect, and builds the shortest path to it. The most profitable fruit is defined as the fruit to which the time is shortest relative to its value. This fruit will be the fruit on which the following calculation: (fruitValue / (timeToFruit/robotSpeed)) is the largest.
      Parameters:
      i - - the index of the robot we updating.

    • nextMove

      public void nextMove()
      Updates the location of the robots, and calculates for each robot its next step if it reaches the dest node.

    • gameOver

      public int gameOver()
      Activate when the game is over. Returns the final result of the game.
      Returns:
      the final result of the game.

    • getGame

      public Server.game_service getGame()
      Gets the game currently load at the gameManager.
      Returns:
      the game currently load at the gameManager

    • getFruits

      public java.util.ArrayList<Fruit> getFruits()
      Gets the fruits currently on game.
      Returns:
      the fruits currently on game.

    • getRobots

      public java.util.ArrayList<Robot> getRobots()
      Gets the robots currently on game.
      Returns:
      the robots currently on game.
